titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Artistic Autographs Collection, 1800-1869
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by the Archives and Special Collections Library.

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Jason Kovari, 12 Feb 2009

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: A set of correpondence to and from various artists, art collectors and art dealers. Correspondents include Elias Magoon and John Britton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: A set of correpondence to and from various artists, art collectors and art dealers. Correspondents include Elias Magoon and John Britton.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Finding aid encoded by Jason Kovari, 12 Feb 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was originally housed in 4 volumes. The collection was removed from those volumes at an unknown time, but probably ca. 1985-1998.
Container list compiled by Jared Berenholz, 2 Feb 2009.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection may have been acquired by the Vassar College in conjunction with the Magoon art collection, now housed at the Frances Lehman Loeb Art Center.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Artistic Autographs, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
